clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Global Smart Drinking Goals Initiative
clinical_study.official_title: Measurement and Evaluation of Global Smart Drinking Goals Initiative

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate effects of a multi-component, population-level intervention on alcohol use and related harms in six intervention cities relative to six matched comparison cities. Intervention components include screening and brief interventions by health providers, other evidence-based interventions (e.g., enforcement of drink-driving or underage drinking laws), and novel or partially tested interventions that warrant further evaluation. Key outcomes of interest include alcohol-related harms such as alcohol-related motor vehicle crashes and fatalities, heavy/binge drinking, underage drinking, and drinking and driving.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study will evaluate effects of a multi-component, population-level intervention on alcohol use and related harms in six intervention cities relative to six matched comparison cities. The trial is expected to expand to nine intervention and nine comparison cities in 2018. Intervention components include screening and brief interventions by health providers, other evidence-based interventions (e.g., enforcement of drink-driving or underage drinking laws), and novel or partially tested interventions that warrant further evaluation. Key outcomes of interest include alcohol-related harms such as alcohol-related motor vehicle crashes and fatalities, heavy/binge drinking, underage drinking, and drinking and driving.
Multiple years of pre- and post-intervention survey data will be collected from cross-sectional samples of adults and youth in each city to assess intervention effects on harmful alcohol use. Multiple years of archival data will also be collected from each city to assess intervention effects on alcohol-related harms such as motor vehicle crashes and fatalities, violence and unintentional injuries. Multi-level analyses will be conducted with data for the total sample of 18 cities and for each pair of cities to determine whether the overall goal of reducing harmful alcohol use by at least 10% is achieved.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Nine pairs of intervention and comparison cities followed over multiple years.

primary_outcome.measure: Health and social harms related to alcohol use
primary_outcome.description: Self-reported problems related to alcohol use (e.g., drinking and driving, injury, unwanted sex, vandalism, property crime); alcohol-related motor vehicle crashes and fatalities

secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported heavy alcohol use (e.g., 5+ drinks within 2 hours)

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived alcohol use and alcohol-related attitudes among family and friends
secondary_outcome.description: Beliefs regarding alcohol use among family and friends, and acceptability of alcohol use
Expectations regarding positive and negative consequences of alcohol use
Knowledge of policies such as the minimum legal drinking age and maximum allowable blood alcohol concentration limit for driving
Perceived likelihood of being asked for age identification, being stopped by police for drinking and driving, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of chronic health risks associated with alcohol use
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported knowledge of possible chronic health-related consequences of alcohol use (e.g., liver cirrhosis, coronary heart disease)

secondary_outcome.measure: Awareness of alcohol health guidance labels and information
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported knowledge of guidance labels and information on beer bottles, cans and elsewhere

secondary_outcome.measure: Consumption of no-alcohol and low-alcohol beer
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported consumption (quantity and frequency) of no-alcohol and low-alcohol beer, no-alcohol and low-alcohol beer sales, underage use of no-alcohol and low-alcohol beer

secondary_outcome.measure: Screening and brief intervention for heavy/binge drinking
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported frequency and impacts, archival medical record data

clinical_study.condition: Binge Drinking, Underage Drinking, Drinking and Driving, Alcohol-Related Harms

arm_group.description: Cities receiving a multi-component intervention, including screening and brief intervention, other evidence-based interventions (e.g., enforcement of drink-driving or underage drinking laws), and novel or partially tested interventions that warrant further evaluation.
Comparison cities receiving no evidence-based interventions.

intervention.description: Multi-component intervention, including screening and brief intervention, other evidence-based interventions, and novel or partially tested interventions that warrant further evaluation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least 12 years old
- Parental consent is be required if under 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Institutionalized individuals

patient_data.ipd_description: De-identified survey and archival data collected for the evaluation will be made available upon completion of the study.
